snippet: Intractable obesity rates in areas like the Bronx suggest that New York City’s previous efforts have not been enough to change behaviors.
abstract: Tally of overweight and obese New Yorkers continues to grow faster in the Bronx than anywhere else in New York City, despite Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's aggressive anti-obesity efforts, including a controversial proposal to ban super-sized and sugary drinks; nearly one in every three Bronx adults is obese, a sign that education efforts and access to healthier foods may not be enough.
lead_paragraph: Intractable obesity rates in areas like the Bronx suggest that New York City’s previous efforts have not been enough to change behaviors.

headline.seo: Persistent Obesity Fuels Soda Ban by Bloomberg
headline.main: Obesity Ills That Won’t Budge Fuel Soda Battle by Bloomberg
headline.print_headline: Obesity Ills That Won’t Budge Fuel Soda Battle by Bloomberg
